website_summaries.verdict: This high-quality tent is easy to set up, and features a 2-pole rectangular dome style with pole clips that easily fit over poles for quick assembly. With  factory sealed fly and floor seams, weatherproof fly buckles, 2 doors for easy entering and leaving, and 2 vestibules for extra gear storage and weather protection,  this tent is a solid choice.
pros: Lots of mesh for added ventilation when it's hot outside
Keeps you dry in the rain
cons: A little less tough than you might want due to its lightweight nature

customer_reviews.title: No better tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: You have to get the floor saver. The floor is thin, but this is but the best tent for the money. The big name brands all campers know are most concerned with weight, and don't make tents this big.The tent and floor saver (without the carry bag) is 5.2lbs
customer_reviews.author: Aaron James Gray

customer_reviews.title: Tent Pole snapped after less than 10 uses....
customer_reviews.text: I really love this tent, but out of nowhere a tent pole snapped tis weekend. It had been set up a few miles into the forest, I left in the morning, bright sunny day, no wind, and came back to this. Cut into the rain fly too, what the hell. Tent was full staked and supported by guy wires and all. Here I am bragging to my friends that they overpaid for their quality and expensive REI tents..... Well looks like they'll have the last laugh afterall. No I have to figure out how to get another pole and probably a back up one too... Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great tent - love it
customer_reviews.text: Fits two comfortably. Mind you my wife and I are thin people and 5' 8" both. so if you are tall and big then you might find this tent on the tighter end. Well ventilated. Very secure on the ground and when you add the cover tarp, very wind resistant. Make sure you tie the point side towards the wind. It helped us weather Algonquin Park up in Canada in below freezing temperature. Water proof but if you don't zip up properly, you may get water inside when opening the zipper in the morning. I like the tan color which helps blend in the nature but the orange stands out so you can find your tent.
customer_reviews.author: Kambiz Nazir

customer_reviews.title: great backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: worked great for a two person tent; loved the vestibules and full fly - kept us dry on a super wet hike. highly recommend. Very easy to put up and take down - very quick. We even cooked in the vestibule area when it rained although I'm sure that's not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: F. Calder

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I have now camped in this tent a few times, once in a huge downpour and not a drop. setup takes a couple minutes, breakdown is just as quick. very roomy inside for 1 person, 2 is tight but doable. for the price, I wonder if there is a better option. I would easily rank this as good as the mountian hardware hammerhead 2 or rei half dome. Accessory pockets are great, the one for the roof is perfect for watching a late night movie. I can't say enough good things, just grab one.
customer_reviews.author: M. IsaacsTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: These are very good tents for the money
customer_reviews.text: These are very good tents for the money. Quality made, lifetime warranty, aluminum poles. Best interior volume in a 2-person tent that I could find. I use it primarily solo, that works great, gives me plenty of room for all my gear. Also has double vestibules for even more room in the dry. I don't backpack with it, mostly canoe and kayak camping. The windows are unique and actually pretty nice to be able to see out. Good ventilation, you will stay dry in this tent. Freestanding design makes for quick easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: RGS

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up, poles broke and bent
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to use this tent on a trip of a lifetime. We tested the tent out and used it a couple of nights on the trip. The first issue was that the bottom of the tent leaked and allowed water in through the seam. The second issue was that the tent poles broke and bent a few nights into the trip. We were forced to sleep in the car which was not enjoyable. I wish that this tent held up, but not recommended unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Waymore than I expected. This Tent packs up small yet it’s tall enough for a 6’3” guy to stretch out without touching his feet or head to the sides. We took it on a three day Motorcycle trip to the mountains and it worked flawlessly rained every night and we stayed dry We took it on a three day trip to the mountains and it worked flawlessly rained every night and we stayed dry
customer_reviews.author: rabbithuntingbeagles

customer_reviews.title: Price Doesn't Negate Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have the Lynx 1 and spent 12 nights in it. The weather was wet, cold, windy. The tent did amazing. Thinking about wanting more room, I gave that tent to my son and bought the Lynx 2-Person. The first camp out it made was 18MPH winds with 30MPH gusts. The tent withstood the rain and the wind like a champ. The poles did shift a bit but overall, it did great! I have plenty of room (I am 6'4" and 270LBS). The only thing is - MAKE SURE YOU BUY THE FOOTPRINT OR BRING A TARP. The floor is thin, to help shave weight, and you don't want to get a rip!
customer_reviews.author: RCParrish

customer_reviews.title: Glad I didn't pay for a big name
customer_reviews.text: Like other people have mentioned this is an exact copy of an REI tent. I ran across the REI at a campground and compared materials and construction. This tent is 99% I saw it as the REI. The only difference was the REI have slightly longer loops on the fly steak loops. I don't think that detail will be missed. Love the tent great value for the money. I really wanted a big name tent. I'm glad I didn't pay the extra money for a name.
customer_reviews.author: Whirly

customer_reviews.title: happy camper!
customer_reviews.text: Finally upgraded and after researching found this one to be ideal. This tent is fairly light weight compared to other 2-man tents. It's well made & very easy to set up. No problems with water getting in the tent thus far. Features I like are the interior pocket for items like your glasses or watch; the loop at top of interior for hanging a mini flashlight, and the rain fly when placed makes two vestibules on either side doors. Items like muddy boots can be stowed out of the tent in the vestibule. I went ahead and purchased the ground cover that went with this model since it is sized perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: McClenahan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent for motorcycle camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent to pack on my motorcycle for camp trips. It packs small and is well made. I am able to fit an Alps Mountaineering lite cot in the tent along with my clothes and motorcycle gear. Setup is easy and the dual doors makes getting in and out easy. I suggest you get a tarp or footprint for this tent since the floor is pretty thin. I have used this in a rain storm and it kept me and my gear dry. Overall this is a quality tent and an awesome price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Nice Vents
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent twice this year now, both in coldish conditions. Tent is light enough to take on a short backpacking trip. The materials are nice and durable, with no visible problems thus far with the mesh or the nylon outers. Ventilation is awesome- minimal condensation build up with two people sleeping in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Wildland firefighter approved!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a wildland firefighter and let me tell you, we beat our gear up. We pack it up every morning and reassemble camp every night. This tent was super lightweight and durable for my latest 21day run. The vestibules and dual doors are really nice for leaving your boots and gear out of the tent to keep it clean inside. There's a net that hooks at the top for hanging stuff inside the tent. It rained a few days and everything inside stayed perfectly dry. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Liz Waisner

customer_reviews.title: Quite possibly the perfect backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: So I originally bought the 1-person but soon realized that once you're in it, there's really no room for gear. I'm kind of anal, even in the wilderness, and prefer to store my gear inside the tent with me. The 2-person allows for that perfectly. And it really didn't add that much noticeable weight to my pack. This is a solid tent, with easy set-up, and the lightweight that backpackers of (most) all intensity levels can appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: mixedblood74

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Tent
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this tent now for several months, ive camped in it many times. Ive been waiting to rate this cause ive yet to camp in the rain with it. Well camping in the rain has happened now, just spent three days on the river canoeing and camping and the second morning at camp the rain came in.. rained steady for about 3 hours with abt thirty minutes of very heavy rains! The tent was bone dry on the insde and held up great! I have a full size air mattress i sleep on and there is plenty of storage under the 2 vestibules.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Great value and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Great value and easy set up. I wish there was a little more head room when lying down. I am 6' and can just barely keep both my toes and my head from touching the walls at the same time. My concern is if raining having moster wick into my sleeping bag if touching the tent. The rain fly should keep this from happening provided you tie it down good as the fly wants to lay on the exterior of the tent without the ties. I use this for motorcycle camping and the second door really comes in handy giving you more useable space for muddy gear.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny A

customer_reviews.title: I think this tent is great I used it for a five day trip
customer_reviews.text: I think this tent is great I used it for a five day trip. It both rained and snowed, and this tent kept me dry the whole time. I kept the rain fly on the whole time, and it is true as mentioned in other reviews that you would have significantly less privacy with the rain fly removed. It's easy to take the fly on and off however so if you are in an area where privacy is a concern you might want to put the rain fly on. The fly itself has vents so it still allows the tent to breathe while the fly is on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tucker

customer_reviews.title: This tent is very warm.
customer_reviews.text: Tent is VERY warm. You could use this in the winter. In 65 degF temp at night, I really was too hot with a rain fly on it. It really needs more mesh in the main tent, or you must not use the fly unless raining or cold. It is easy to setup, well made, and comes with things that others charge you for like the extra stakes and tie downs as well as the mesh thing to hold stuff. My only real complaint was that I was expecting orange poles, as in the pictures and videos, and got blue which I dislike.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Waugh

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly sturdy tent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just had this tent out for the first time this past weekend and it got a serious workout. We were on a ridge catching some serious wind and rain. Bigger tents were pancaking all around me but my ALPS just rode out the weather and kept me dry. No leaks from the floor and rain flap worked great. All my gear stayed dry in both vestibules. I'll be a fan of these tents for life.
customer_reviews.author: Jonce

customer_reviews.title: Good Product and good ALPS customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 a few months ago, Very nice. Have gone camping a few times now, and its just perfect. In a warm day (and dry) you can take off the rain fly to let some air in, in a rainy day, the rain fly does a very good job keeping you dry. Easy to set up, good quality. One of them came with a defective rain fly, I called amazon, and they offered me to replace the tent immediately. But for some reason I called ALPS, and they offered me to replace the rain fly, no questions asked. I had the new fly 5 days later. Awsome. I would buy from them (ALPS and amazon again).
customer_reviews.author: Bledo

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for 2 people!
customer_reviews.text: This tent has worked out for my girlfriend and I very well! It is the easiest tent to set up that I've ever used, and it's pretty light! The screen did have a few minor defects, but in every spot that there was a defect, the holes in the screen were smaller, not larger, so no bugs could get through. It's light to carry, super easy to set up, and keeps rain out very well. You can fit a Full sized air mattress inside of it. Its ventilation isn't the best, but if it's not going to be incredibly hot where you're going, you won't have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Quality tent, but not best for general use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for some summer camping. If it's a warm weekend and you can do without the fly it's great. However, the tent's footprint gets substantially larger with the fly, and it's a bit awkward if you want to get in and out frequently. I suspect it's better for "mountaineering" use. Not a bad tent, just keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for price, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Great budget backpacking tent. Easy to set up amd take down. Could be done by one person easily. With 2 people takes around 5 minutes. Hauled this for 3 days on a backcountry trip in Yellowstone and no complaints. Roomy headspace, didnt leak in light rain. Used a cheap tarp as a footpad which doesnt come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A tad heavier than other 2 man, great design, materials and price
customer_reviews.text: Not the lightest out there but great for the price. Well made, they thought out the details I like. Quick setup, great vents on both sides of top of rainfly, lots of roof mesh for stargazing, strong pointy stakes,gear loft net, double entry and vestibules. Bigger footprint than other 2 person tents, roomy for bigger guys like me 6’4”.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy for one person
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems to be good, time will tell. Probably to heavy for back packing but will work well for kayak camping. Easy set up even for one person. Took me less than 10 min to put up tent for the evening.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: So spacious and easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my foray into backpacking and I couldn't be happier. It has so much room, especially if you utilize the vestibules for storing your gear. I am six feet tall and love that I can sit up inside it without hitting my head, even with the gear loft attached. It's a breeze to set up and take down. So incredibly happy with this more affordable tent!! Buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: Cougsoozgmail com

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and cheap - poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this tent a total of 5 times. The stakes that come with it are useles, unless you’re driving them into moist lush ground. They bend easily. The stitching that holds the pole loops is already ripping and coming undone. I’ll be lucky to get one more camping trip out of it for a total of 6 times and then trash.
customer_reviews.author: jef black

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is relatively light for backpacking and sets up very quick. I have the 2 man Lynx and it is perfect for myself , gear and a dog. Having 2 doors is great if you load one side with gear. I have used it a few times and it is holding up well. I would recommend this tent for people just starting out or looking for a good tent at a great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Drunk Cow

customer_reviews.title: No window cover for privacy.  Compact & lightweight for motorcycle camping.
customer_reviews.text: Just received it and set it up. No instructions but you really don't need them....it is easy and uncomplicated to set-up. Appears well made and has many little features that make it better, that might be missing from cheaper tents. My only complaint is there is a small see-through window on both sides with NO privacy screen to be lowered to cover them.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Pass the flash flood test.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Went primitive in high winds and rain with no problem. I bought the under fly and lily that as well. Easy setup and excellent aluminum support. Zipper details are excellent with no propensity to zip on itself. Zipper tension also excellent. Fly is well designed with six anchor points but only comes with four anchors. Everything stores in nice pouches and the tent itself has compression both on the tent and the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Great in bad weather
customer_reviews.text: slept in this tent for a week in mexico. It was windy up to 30 - 40 mph, from multiple dirctions, poured rain one day, and was low 50s. with the rain fly on this tent kept me warm, dry and it handled the wind incredibly. great design, well made with quick and easy setup when its dark cold and youre tired! I used the one-person model for 14 nights and it was great also. Thanks Alps! I didnt receive anything for this review. 🇲🇽
customer_reviews.author: Pigbear

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Light and setup is a breeze. I put it up in my living room the 1st time and them timed setup. It took about 7 minutes to setup and about 5 minutes to tear down. I took it on a bike/hiking trip and it had plenty of room. I like that there is a vestibule on each side of the tent. It rained on one of the nights and everything stayed dry. I like this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Xcbikerider

customer_reviews.title: Great small compact and lightweight tent but cheap plastic on rainfly
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, zippers work great, fast to pack and lightweight. Only issue I have is with the plastic windows on the rainfly - after a year of normal use (only camped in it for about 6 days total) the plastic started tearing along where the rainfly was being folded. The plastic is cheap and cracked all over, I’m needing to use duct tape to fix it. If it weren’t for the rainfly I’d give 4 or 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Just set it up indoors for a few days because camping indoors is still fun. Both sides open to get a good cross ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it outside yet. Just set it up indoors for a few days because camping indoors is still fun. Both sides open to get a good cross breeze. Set up was so easy. I haven't set up a tent for a decade and still got this out of the box and up in 5 minutes. The hook design for the pole attachments to the tent is great compared to closed loop or sleeves like previous tents I've had. Comfortably fit 2 people in it and I plan to use it to sleep 2 and a 50lb dog.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for a single sleeper!
customer_reviews.text: Going from a one man pup tent to this two man Lynx feels like you're sleeping in a mansion. Easy set-up and good materials. Haven't tested it in the rain yet but the full rain fly seems like it'll hold up well. Repacking the tent is kind of a pain but Alps has a youtube video that gives some pretty good advice when doing so, albeit slightly time consuming. For one full sized adult, the tent has plenty of room but if you're sleeping two, I'd imagine it could be tight.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Good camping/hiking tent.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent to use camping and hiking. I went out the other day and it worked great!. Light weight easy to set up and fast. We did it in the dark without issue. The tent stood up to windy conditions but it wasn’t going to rain so I didn’t use the rain fly. The tent accommodates 2 without gear or one with gear. A roomy light tent. The big door flaps were good for Easy entry and exit for each person without climbing over each other. A great purchase
customer_reviews.author: JPGNEW

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars bc they achieved what they aimed for in this price tier. My last tent blew away in a storm, got this one, and there was a windy storm the first time i used it. I used all of the features available to secure it and it stood like a rock. Easy set up. Aesthetically plzing yadda yadda. Good airflow. I love that the whole upper hakd can be unzipped so that only the mesh is seen, so i can lay inside and see and hear all the trees blow. Im v pleased
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tent is an excellent size for two people (meaning unlike a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: This tent is an excellent size for two people (meaning unlike a lot of 2 person backpacking tents, one person does not need to be physically inside the other to be in the tent). It's easy to assemble and only has 2 polls, the rainfly has space on either side for boots and packs, and it's relatively light. I would definitely recommend this tent, and also recommend getting the footprint to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great tent.
customer_reviews.text: Used those as a one man tent on a seven day kayak camping trip. It's small enough to fit in the hatch in a dry bag, and easy to set up and break down every day. Works well as one man tent to keep clothes and supplies inside and scorpions and spiders outside. You'll want a tarp under the floor to protect it.
customer_reviews.author: wxyz

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a basic backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent appears to be well constructed, stable, easy to set up and pack away, and has plenty of space for me and my gear inside the tent. It is heavier than more expensive tents, but works well for beginning backpackers like me at price much less than other tents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for solo trips.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice tent and perfect for solo. I use this for hunting and plenty of room inside for gear etc. also has vestibule space for weathered gear. Quick setup and back pack size for packing. I would not get this for two for hunting. Not enough room for two with gear.
customer_reviews.author: gw hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great tent so far. Pretty lightweight, 2 person fit comfortably, and easy setup. You can't ask for much more for a lightweight durable tent. I have not had any issues so far. I would recommend grabbing some extra stakes though as the first time you try to push the ones that come with the tent into harder ground they tend to bend easily (part of being lightweight). Overall great choice for the average camper or someone who lives in the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pezant

customer_reviews.title: Great all around motorcycle camping tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent. Set up was easy I could set it up at night no problem. This will be great In the fall, even winter. The dual entry with nice dual vestibules are wonderful. Keeps the tent clean. This tent is durable and can handle extream. I had it in wind and hard rain. I had it tied down and it didn't move. Dry inside.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great for one person
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for festival gig work for a couple years camping at least three weeks at a time on job sites. Keeps out insects very well offers good viewing, ventilation but also offers privacy when wanted. The Double small vestibules are my favorite feature, it gives you the option to keep one side closed to the sun or both open for a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Remus

customer_reviews.title: Great for Moto Camping
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room, easy setup, good airflow, two doors are a nice feature. Downside? I wonder how well the floor will hold up. It's really thin.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Heck Yea!
customer_reviews.text: Great 2 (wo)man tent! Construction is solid, very compact perfect for backpacking adventures. All functions are pretty intuitive, set it up in about 5 mins right out of the box. Would recommend getting a tarp for extra protection as the bottom seems like it might need it. Really digg the openings on both sides, allows for easy entrance/exit withour disturbing the other person by having to step over them; that's not to mention the outside gear storage space which I presume will come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kobayashimaru91

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: If there was a way to close off the windows, this would be a perfect tent. Set-up and take down is easy, the size is just right, and the mesh made for excellent ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: meyd1

customer_reviews.title: great tent!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the tent a couple times and it performed very well! On one of the trips that I took, it rained all night and most of the morning and I was perfectly dry. The only thing that I recommend when purchasing this is that you get the floor saver and different steaks.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent for the price, the only thing I don't care for is the rain fly has a plastic window panel on each end that I could do without. Otherwise it really is a sweet little tent. it's very easy to set up and very light compared to my much older and more expensive tents but so far seems just as durable and weather worthy as the old North Face that it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have set it up in the backyard before taking it on a trip. It seems to be great quality for the price. Relatively lightweight, plenty of room for two, and easy to set up. I will update the overall rating once we use it on a trip to judge the warmth and durability. The ratings, the two doors, and the style of the rainfly were the main reasons I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Magnusson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent at a terrific value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent at a terrific value! I looked a comparable Big Agnes tent which was twice the price and I am very satisfied with the quality and durability of this tent. I have been camping and backpacking for 20 years so I am very particular about my gear. This tent measure up in every aspect and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wright

customer_reviews.title: Simply Ideal
customer_reviews.text: Buckle up because here we go. This tent is compact. Light. Easy too set up. its a 2 person tent and they mean 2 person. Seriously. Don't try to fit 3 people in here. it is a super clutch tent in a pinch. If I could change one thing about this tent is.... er... um... nothing? don't fix whats not broke. BUY ITTTTT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: So far its been great. Used a few nights and fit me easily and had room for one more person. Packs down small enough for my motorcycle and for the money pretty tough to beat
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tent for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for his Birthday. He absolutely loves it! Definitely easy to put together. The stakes are very light, and bend easily. Otherwise, a great tent. He has used it to sleep in, or just to hang out in during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good size and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Good size and easy to set up. Light enough to pack but still strong enough to stand up to the weather.
customer_reviews.author: SCJ

customer_reviews.title: Windows tear very easily
customer_reviews.text: The “windows” on the rain fly are very easy to tear and almost rip with no force applied to them at all. It seems to be a design flaw or just cheap material because I have both a Lynx 2 and Lynx 4 with the same problem. I had to duct tape the holes which solved the problem, but they look like crap.
customer_reviews.author: sooners68

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product, missing parts required to assemble properly.
customer_reviews.text: The product is missing a buckle on one of the corners for the Flysheet. The instructions clearly state on step #4) "Attach the buckle at each tent corner..." My tent arrived with only 3 buckles, while the flysheet has 4 buckles. Make sure if you order this product you have enough time ship to back for replacement, I'm going to have to go on the trip with the missing buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Will see how it will hold up and will provide follow up feedback. It was super easy to setup and very large space inside for two.
customer_reviews.author: Lonely Planet

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: We used it on the beach and it worked great! Easy to put up and take down. It rained pretty hard and we were snug and dry. They rain fly worked great. Did not use the bottom liner.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super simple. Durable material. Great design.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal tent. Incredible quick and easy to set up. Fits 2 people and gear comfortably inside. Also fits a full air mattress fully inflated. The vestibules on either side are great as well. Super easy to get back into the storage bag, unlike other tents that you have to wrestle for 45 minutes and struggle to zip it up.
customer_reviews.author: BIGEV

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent.
customer_reviews.text: We have used this tent a lot, and it has not let us down. I love the double doors and double vestibules. Included with the tent is a very handy gear loft.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A. Sears

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ADV motorcycle camping.
customer_reviews.text: Sets up quickly, breaks down into a small size, lightweight - perfect for ADV riders.
customer_reviews.author: BmanTN

customer_reviews.title: True 2 person tent
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 3 night hike without any issues. It made it through afternoon thunderstorms and even some brief hail. This is a true 2 person tent.
customer_reviews.author: MTmace

customer_reviews.title: This was a very easy tent to setup and take down without even reading ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a very easy tent to setup and take down without even reading the directions. I used this tent on a 4 day elk hunt and I loved it. Not enough room for 2 people though once all your gear is in the tent with you and I do wish the vestibules had a little bit more room. Loved the full rain fly although it didn't rain. Cool design and color if that matters to you.
customer_reviews.author: JOSH

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful tent that bears all sorts of weather like a tank.
customer_reviews.text: I got this tent as a needed item for long camping and working in the field. I just put it through its maiden voyage as a part of my kit. 8 days at 9k ft and it performed better than any tent I've ever owned. High winds, heavy rain, cold nights, hot days. Not once was it anything but fantastic. Anyone looking for a tent, I would highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Love this little tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this little tent! Great buy for the price, and I love alps mountaineering. Solidly waterproof and very roomy! I really love that it has a door on each side and a vestibule for each door under the fly. It has already gone on 2 trips is the first few weeks we've had it, and it's amazing. Packs small and it lightweight enough to not be bulky.
customer_reviews.author: kendall

customer_reviews.title: good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: used immediately in colorado. heavy rains several nites, dry inside. good product for the money. no complaints, very happy. good for backpacking or motorcycle travel. sets up fast and easy. packs up small.
customer_reviews.author: Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent, a bit heavy but for the price it is reasonable. Dual entry and vestibule help it perform well. (No crawling over each other) Fits a queen air mattress snugly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M

customer_reviews.title: Great (and warm)!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this tent once in the grand canyon so far, and we were expecting it to be pretty chilly out. It got kinda cold, but not in our tent! We were basically sleeping outside of our sleeping bags before we noticed there were heat vents at the top of the rain-fly. So far, not a purchase I regret in the least!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kraten Fox

customer_reviews.title: Fit two people and a cat
customer_reviews.text: Pretty spacious for a two person. Well thought out design. Pleasant colors and visually comfortable and attractive from inside and out. Lightweight and easy to set up. Did quite a bit of research and knew what I want before buying this tent. Use the "Floor saver" or a tarp-the floor is pretty thin. But overall a great tent. This was a gift but I went and bought myself an Alps Extreme 2 tent later on.
customer_reviews.author: Zenabi

customer_reviews.title: easy two pole setup
customer_reviews.text: easy two pole setup, packing down is super simple, bag has compression straps so getting the tent back in the bag is very simple, overhead loft for lighting or storage and small pockets on either side. not the lightest at about 6 lbs but it works well
customer_reviews.author: John Riccio

customer_reviews.title: This is easily the best tent I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best tent I've ever purchased. Super light weight and compact. Poles are very sturdy, color coordinated and go together with ease. The set up makes it easy enough for one person to set up without a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny V

customer_reviews.title: Great tent all around
customer_reviews.text: Great tent all around. The two person version of this tent is huge, it's really more of a three person. That is the reason I gave it only four stars, it could be a little smaller therefore a little lighter. It was very easy and fast to set up. The seams are taped and zippers are nice and sound. Just a great tent over all.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a well made and simple tent. Shared this with my wife for a week and wish I had bought the 3 person. The two man would be a perfect tent for 1 plus some gear. With two people there is no room for gear.
customer_reviews.author: HADES

customer_reviews.title: good tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. Sets up in 3 minutes. Withstood heavy downpours and windy conditions
customer_reviews.author: dude

customer_reviews.title: The storm cover has a clear plastic window in each ...
customer_reviews.text: The storm cover has a clear plastic window in each end. This lets in unwanted sunlight and exposes you to the view of our fellow campers while you are trying to change clothes. This is quiet severe design incompetence. And is probably why the picture to the left doesn't show the cover.
customer_reviews.author: loadofbs

customer_reviews.title: The vents are great and no problems with condensation buildup at all
customer_reviews.text: Have used this tent 6 times now and it’s very well made. The vents are great and no problems with condensation buildup at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Packs small and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this ALPS Lynx tent is a pretty good value. Light and easy to put up.
customer_reviews.author: SGinOR

customer_reviews.title: I liked the smooth sipper action much better than others I ...
customer_reviews.text: Took on a overnight hiking trip. Tent performed very well and was very roomy. I liked the smooth sipper action much better than others I have used and owned. Although a one person tent would have been half the weight it was well worth it for extra room to move around and gear space.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money and very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: MPB

customer_reviews.title: relatively easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: relatively easy to set up, I used this the last week of field camp (car-ish camping) and The headroom is fabulous.and it fits my queen air mattress without stretching out the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Tai Subia

customer_reviews.title: Good valued tent.
customer_reviews.text: Used it many time over the last one an half year's and have had no problems with this tent in rain hail and shine. I still don't know how I feel about the little clear windows, I like them a lot sometimes and other time not, but, they're easy to cover. Very good value, Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Clive

customer_reviews.title: Warmer weather.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great. Not quite light enough for my taste but is easy to set up and is warm; as long as you don't go camping when it's under 40 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: Worried About Comfort

customer_reviews.title: ALPS comes through in all my camping gear!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Easy to set up, made to last. I love all my ALPS mountaineering gear!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this tent for backpacking/camping
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this tent for backpacking/camping. I just grab this my hammock, climbing gear, and a clean pair of unders and I am all set!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first at the Delaware Seashore State Park and noticed the zipper broke. Other than the broken zipper, the tent worked great. I hope ALPS Mountaineering will improve its quality inspection. Paul - Downingtown.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for motorcycle camping. Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for motorcycle camping. Small enough to fit in the trunk of an BMW RT.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Solid tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. I used it daily on a road trip. Setting this up by myself was no problem at all. My only complaint is the rain fly zippers get caught very easily. Also worth noting, it is unclear in the picture but there are small windows in the rain cover(still rain proof).
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Great tent that's incredibly light and easy to throw up ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tent that's incredibly light and easy to throw up on a camping trip. Glad I made the decision to replace my 15-year-old tent and look forward to the many adventures ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Zieminski

customer_reviews.title: Good Backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice tent for the price.. i wouldn't say the zips are particularly good quality; they feel cheap to me. Apart from that, its really easy to set up and really keeps the water out (used it in a rain storm and stayed dry). Its reasonably light too- i use it for overnight backpacking trips and it would fit in a 50L pack no problem. I use a 85L pack which is more than enough for the tent, sleeping bag and my sleeping pad (which is massive). Its also very spacious inside compared to most '2-man' tents i have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Doug M

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product, wish the bottom was morr durable.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is a breeze to set up but as lightweight as it is, it is prone to tearing. I recommend placing a tarp down on the ground before setting up camp.
customer_reviews.author: John Mossbacher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent and value.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. Lightweight, great construction, great ventilation, easy setup, thoughtful features (love the mesh storage area on top in the middle, great for putting a light there), and affordable. Great value and plan on using it for years to come. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Nice sized tent! 1 person all gear room to spare. Easy to set up. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: I am a very happy camper!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, great price! Bigger than I thought and will be comfortable for two adults. The mesh is a godsend for our hot and humid summers with the rain-fly for the cooler temps! Easily put up in two minutes without any help! Small enough to fit inside my duffel-bag which I strap on my bike. I had a small problem after receiving this tent but one email was plenty enough to clear it all up! Top customer service!
customer_reviews.author: allan van der

customer_reviews.title: Big for a 2-person.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set-up and the perfect size. For backpacking, it's large by 2-person standards, but still plenty manageable (especially with a partner who can take the fly/stakes). For car camping, it's juuuust big enough for a queen air mattress. You won't be able to fit anything else in there, but with the vestibule you won't need to. I haven't camped in rough weather yet, but will update if/when I do.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel K Riffle

customer_reviews.title: Stayed dry and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Spent 3 days and nights in the georgia mountains, rained every day but i stayed dry. Tent is also very warm as it got down to 20 degrees. Love this tent. Will be buying another for my brother.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tent is very nice. I haven't used it in any adverse conditions
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very nice. I haven't used it in any adverse conditions, but it has held up well so far. It packs well and is light. For two good sized people it fits very well. I am also a big fan of the overhead compartment. I usually stick my phone up there and it works well. Definitely the best option for a backpacking tent under $150
customer_reviews.author: Cole Deming

customer_reviews.title: Awesome full featured tent!
customer_reviews.text: Setup literally took me 5 minutes without even reading the instructions. I love the "private entry" for each side and the large vestibules for gear the rain fly provides. Stakes are a little wimpy, we'll see how they hold up on the AT in a few weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: I can fit my claustrophobic 6'1 husband in here with no problems. Good backpacking tent if you're sharing the weight with others or like your space.
customer_reviews.author: Kaprkorn

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Lynx 2-Person Tent
product_meta.description: The ALPS Mountaineering Lynx Tent is packed with high quality, top notch features. The Lynx, which has aluminum poles opposed to fiberglass poles, is very similar to our Taurus Tent series. The Lynx has more mesh than the Taurus, taking up half of the walls on each side allowing even more ventilation. The tent is an easy to set up, 2 pole rectangular dome style tent with pole clips that easily fit over the poles for quick assembly. ALPS has not cut any corners... between the factory sealed fly and floor seams, weatherproof fly buckles, 2 doors for easy entering and leaving, 2 vestibules for extra gear storage or weather protection, and extra-large #8 zippers, you're sure to find everything you could want in a tent with our Lynx.
feature_bullets: There's no assembly frustration with our Lynx Tent series; this free-standing, aluminum two-pole design is a breeze to setup
Polyester tent fly resists water and UV damage while adding two vestibules for extra storage space
Fully equipped with #8 zippers, storage pockets, gear loft, aluminum stakes, guy ropes and two doorways
The ALPS Mountaineering Lynx Tent is on our best sellers list; it’s a must-have for your next adventure
Base Size: 5' x 7'6, Center Height: 46", Total Weight: 5 lbs. 12 oz. , Minimum Weight: 5 lbs. 1 oz. , Color: Clay/Rust

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
